title: Police investigate apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Police are investigating an apparent murder-suicide at a home on Colonial Drive in Beverly.
A man and a woman were found dead with gunshot wounds; names are withheld pending next of kin notification.
Beverly police, State Police, and the Chief Medical Examiner's office are involved, with no threat to the public.

title: Canton police sergeant involved in Karen Read case placed on leave over alleged misconduct
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Canton Police Sgt. Sean Goode placed on paid leave pending investigation into misconduct allegations discovered during a separate law enforcement investigation.
The allegations against Goode do not specify if they are related to the Karen Read murder case he initially investigated.
An independent investigator is conducting a thorough administrative investigation into the misconduct allegations, with the investigation ongoing.

title: It’s the end of the line for Hubba Hubba in Cambridge
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hubba Hubba in Cambridge will close on Nov. 24 after 40 years due to financial difficulties and rising costs.
Owner M.J. Pullins mentioned challenges like increased rent, building repairs, and city construction for the store's closure.
Pullins hopes a new sex-positive alternative store will open, as community support is crucial amid the current political climate.

title: ‘Unacceptable’: What Jaylen Brown, NBA official had to say about controversial moment in Celtics’ loss
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Celtics lose to Jazz 105-103 after controversial no-call in final minute involving Jaylen Brown.
Jaylen Brown criticized officials for not calling a foul, claiming it cost the Celtics the game.
NBA referee Kevin Scott explained the no-call, stating both players slipped before any contact.

title: Moving to Massachusetts isn’t easy — when did you finally feel at home?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Hayley Perry-Sanchez struggled to adapt after moving from Seattle to Cambridge for her husband's Harvard MBA program.
High living costs, harsh weather, and social isolation challenged Perry-Sanchez during her first winter in Cambridge.
Perry-Sanchez found community by engaging in local craft stores, fostering connections beyond Harvard's environment.

title: Parts of Morrissey Blvd. may close this week due to high tide flooding
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Morrissey Blvd. may close from Tuesday to Sunday due to high tide flooding expected by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation & Recreation.
Potential closures will affect the area between Freeport Street and Bianculli Boulevard, with possible impacts on the I-93 off ramp.
High tides in the Morrissey Blvd. area are forecasted to reach 12 feet daily, peaking between November 4 and November 9.

title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Polls in Boston open 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. across 275 precincts for Tuesday's municipal election.
Mayor Michelle Wu runs unopposed, while contested races for City Council include at-large and district seats.
32,737 of 51,769 mail ballots returned, with ballots accepted at 22 drop boxes or at City Hall by 8 p.m.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins' second line, featuring Pavel Zacha, Casey Mittelstadt, and Viktor Arvidsson, has been instrumental in recent wins.
Coach Marco Sturm utilizes healthy scratches to motivate players, exemplified by Casey Mittelstadt's resurgence after being benched.
The Bruins consider possible trades of key players like Mittelstadt and Arvidsson to accelerate roster retooling before the trade deadline.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalists for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet, Red Sox pitcher, is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award alongside Tarik Skubal and Hunter Brown.
Crochet led the American League in innings pitched and strikeouts, posting an 18-5 record with a 2.59 ERA.
Red Sox rookie Roman Anthony is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year with A's Nick Kurtz and Jacob Wilson.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots prioritize acquiring an edge rusher to strengthen pass-rushing after inconsistent pressure on quarterbacks this season.
New England seeks a reliable running back due to injuries with Antonio Gibson out and Rhamondre Stevenson's toe injury.
Patriots aim to address thin depth in their secondary with potential trade deadline moves for versatile defensive backs.
